alert.note: Alert for Interior Cumberland Highlands; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 21 at 3:22AM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING SNOW AND SOME MIXED PRECIPITATION TO THE REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move eastward from the eastern Great Lakes States on Wednesday and then across southern New England late Wednesday night and Thursday. Snow is expected to overspread the watch area from west to east Wednesday night and may be heavy at times. Sleet and freezing drizzle may mix in late Wednesday night and especially Thursday. Another period of snow may occur Thursday night into Friday with more minor accumulations possible. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations greater than 8 inches possible. Freezing drizzle possible Thursday. * WHERE...Portions of south central and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...A period of heavy snow could combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions Wednesday night and Thursday. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
